SourcedStatement: A prospective District 7 councilmember sued the Alameda County Registrar of Voters last week, saying in a petition that three of her supporters’ signatures required to qualify for the ballot were incorrectly discounted due to “minor technical errors.”
Name: Alameda County Registrar of Voters

SourcedStatement: To qualify, a candidate needs to gather and submit at least 50 valid signatures; the registrar approved only 47 for Love.
Name: the registrar
Justification: Alameda County Registrar of Voters

SourcedStatement: Under the Voter’s Choice Act, registered voters on Election Day can cast their ballots at any vote center in Alameda County.
Name: Voter’s Choice Act

SourcedStatement: Judge Markman said that it appeared that the county registrar, Tim Dupuis, didn’t do “anything wrong” in this instance.
Name: the county registrar
Justification: Alameda County Registrar of Voters

SourcedStatement: “In its implementation, it looks like the ROV attempted to do that here.”
Name: the ROV
Justification: Alameda County Registrar of Voters

SourcedStatement: The Alameda County Registrar is scheduled to send the final ballot for printing on Friday.
Name: The Alameda County Registrar

SourcedStatement: If the court rules in Love’s favor, the Registrar will be forced to change the ballot at the last minute.
Name: the Registrar
Justification: Alameda County Registrar of Voters

SourcedStatement: Tonya Love, former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife, failed to qualify for the council race earlier this month because she hadn’t gathered enough signatures.
Name: Tonya Love
Justification: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife

SourcedStatement: To qualify, a candidate needs to gather and submit at least 50 valid signatures; the registrar approved only 47 for Love.
Name: Love
Justification: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife

SourcedStatement: As a result, Love said that she would not be running for the District 7 seat.
Name: Love
Justification: former district director for California Assemblymember Rob Bonta and current chief of staff for Councilmember Carroll Fife

SourcedStatement: “While we are disappointed by the court’s decision not to place us on the ballot in November, I remain undeterred in my commitment to serving Oakland and our communities,” she wrote.
Name: she
Justification: Love

SourcedStatement: “My dedication to our city does not begin nor end with a campaign.
Name: she
Justification: Love

SourcedStatement: There are many ways to effect change and ensure our voices are heard.
Name: she
Justification: Love

SourcedStatement: I will continue to work alongside each of you, advocating for public health, safety, and equitable development in Oakland.”
Name: she
Justification: Love

SourcedStatement: After hearing both sides this morning in county court, Alameda County Superior Court Judge Michael Markman said he would issue his ruling by 3 p.m. today.
Name: Michael Markman
Title: Judge
Justification: Alameda County Superior Court Judge

SourcedStatement: Judge Markman said that it appeared that the county registrar, Tim Dupuis, didn’t do “anything wrong” in this instance.
Name: Markman
Title: Judge
Justification: Alameda County Superior Court Judge

SourcedStatement: “My understanding is that there are other candidates for this particular district city council who would’ve liked the opportunity to have more time to gather and submit signatures, and the process needs to be uniform,” he said.
Name: he
Justification: Judge Michael Markman

SourcedStatement: “In its implementation, it looks like the ROV attempted to do that here.”
Name: he
Justification: Judge Michael Markman

SourcedStatement: The judge also noted that he was wary of approving the request lest it turn the courts into “a clearing house for attempting to verify signatures.”
Name: The judge
Title: judge
Justification: Alameda County Superior Court Judge Michael Markman

SourcedStatement: “There are only three in this one,” he said, “but I can imagine scenarios where it could be 23 in future cases.”
Name: he
Justification: Judge Michael Markman

SourcedStatement: If the signatures are validated, Love will become a candidate in a five-person race for a seat that opened up only because of a last-minute decision by sitting Councilmember Treva Reid not to run for reelection, citing the increasing health care needs of her mother.
Name: Love

Justification: a nephew of Black Panther Party founder Huey Newton

SourcedStatement: In an interview with The Oaklandside last week, Newton was resigned to his failure to gather enough signatures–he picked up 37–but said he would work with whoever came out ahead in the race to help improve the community.
Name: Newton

SourcedStatement: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group, said in their petition that Love had gathered 67 signatures in total and that three of the signatures were unfairly disqualified.
Name: Love’s lawyers
Justification: from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

SourcedStatement: “These technical errors should not prevent the intent of the voters from being realized and the signatures counted towards verification,” the lawyers stated in their brief.
Name: the lawyers
Justification: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

SourcedStatement: “The Elections Code and Oakland Ordinances only require that registered voters residing within the District sign the petition.
Name: the lawyers
Justification: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

SourcedStatement: The three individuals who signed the nomination petition but did not have their signatures counted met these basic requirements and, in addition, substantially complied with the applicable law.”
Name: the lawyers
Justification: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

SourcedStatement: The county attorneys countered in a brief that the state election code deems signatures on a nomination form invalid if they don’t include a signature and a printed name and if the address of the candidate’s supporter is not consistent with their voter registration form.
Name: The county attorneys

SourcedStatement: Love’s lawyers argued that the same courtesy should apply to signatures for council candidates.
Name: Love’s lawyers
Justification: from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

SourcedStatement: The lawyers asked the court to direct the registrar to validate those signatures and place Love on the Nov. 5 ballot.
Name: The lawyers
Justification: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

SourcedStatement: After hearing both sides this morning in county court, Alameda County Superior Court Judge Michael Markman said he would issue his ruling by 3 p.m. today.
Name: both sides

SourcedStatement: The lawyer representing Love said that the judge could limit his ruling to the type of unusual last-minute circumstance this represents, in which a candidate had only a couple of days to gather signatures.
Name: The lawyer representing Love

SourcedStatement: Her lawyers also argued that the district has a low number of registered voters, making it harder for her to secure as many signatures.
Name: Her lawyers
Justification: Love’s lawyers, from the political law firm Kaufman Legal Group

SourcedStatement: After Love’s lawyers submitted their petition on Aug. 20, the Alameda Court originally set a conference for September 24, but lawyers for the county asked for the hearing to be moved up to today, to ensure there was enough time to create the ballots.
Name: lawyers for the county
